top_code:
import Mathlib
universe u v w u_1 u_2 u_3 u₁ u₂ u₃
set_option maxHeartbeats 10000000
set_option linter.unreachableTactic false
lean_code:
def Divisible (d x : ℤ) : Prop :=
    ∃ y : ℤ, x = d * y
  theorem Int.Divisible.lean_of_coprime_div : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → 3 ∣ n :=
    by
    have assert_1216407535351519494 : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → ∃ (k : ℤ), n = 12 * k :=
      by
      intro n a
      exact a
    intro n a
    (omega)
    have assert_5911585881831806573 : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → ∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂ := by
      first
      | linarith
      | ring
      | norm_num
      | simp
      | omega
      | rfl
    have assert_7084418409735630201 : ∀ (n k₁₂ : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → n = 12 * k₁₂ → n = 3 * 4 * k₁₂ := by
      first
      | linarith
      | ring
      | norm_num
      | simp
      | omega
      | rfl
    have assert_7084418409735630201 : ∀ (n k₁₂ : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → n = 12 * k₁₂ → n = 3 * (4 * k₁₂) := by
      first
      | linarith
      | ring
      | norm_num
      | simp
      | omega
      | rfl
    intro n a
    (omega)
    let m : ℤ := 4 * k₁₂
    have assert_6611035146883819026 : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → ∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ) (m : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂ ∧ m = 4 * k₁₂ ∧ n = 3 * m :=
      by
      intro n a
      simp_all only [exists_and_left, exists_eq_left]
      sorry
    have : ∀ (n : ℤ), 12 ∣ n → ∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂ → ∃ (m : ℤ), m = 4 * k₁₂ → 3 ∣ n :=
      by
      intro n a
      simp_all only
      sorry
    intro n a
    (omega)
    have :
      ∀ {k₁₂ : ℤ} (n : ℤ),
        (∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂) →
          (∃ (m : ℤ), m = 4 * k₁₂) →
            ∀ (n : ℤ), (∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂) → (∃ (m : ℤ), m = 4 * k₁₂) → ∃ (k₃ : ℤ), n = 3 * k₃ :=
      by sorry
    intro n a
    (omega)
    have : ∀ (n : ℤ), (∃ (k₁₂ : ℤ), n = 12 * k₁₂) → ∃ (m : ℤ), n = 3 * m :=
      by
      intro n a
      obtain ⟨w, h⟩ := a
      subst h
      sorry
    intro n a
    (omega)
    intro n a
    (omega)

document.label: def:divisibility
document.definition: For integers d and x, Divisible(d,x) holds if and only if there exists an integer y such that x = d · y.

items.statement: Let n be an arbitrary integer.

results_used.statement: Divisible(d,x) holds if and only if there exists an integer y such that x = d · y.

items.claim: there exists an integer k such that n = 12 · k.

items.statement: Denote by k₁₂ an integer satisfying n = 12 · k₁₂.
Denote by m the integer m := 4 · k₁₂.

items.claim: Divisible(3,n) holds by Definition 1 with witness m.
Divisible(12,n) → Divisible(3,n) follows from A₁ and C₂.
For every integer n, Divisible(12,n) implies Divisible(3,n).

document.label: thm:divisible_by_12_implies_divisible_by_3
document.claim: For every integer n, Divisible(12,n) implies Divisible(3,n).
